original: 於是捨眾辭師裹糧東逝。
analyzed: 於是捨眾辭師裹糧東逝。
translated: Thereupon, he left the community, took leave of his teacher, packed his provisions, and headed east.
He traveled for three years, enduring the cold and heat.
After crossing the Pamir Mountains, he passed through six countries.
The rulers of the countries admired his distant teachings.
They all offered him their support and provisions.

original: 至交阯乃附舶循海而行。
analyzed: 至交阯乃附舶循海而行。
translated: When he reached Jiaozhi, he boarded a ship and sailed along the coast.
As they passed an island,
Xian pointed to a mountain and said:
We should stop here.
The ship's captain said:
When traveling, one should cherish every day. It is difficult to encounter favorable winds.
It cannot be stopped.
We traveled more than two hundred li.
Suddenly the wind turned and blew the ship back down to the island.
The people realized its divinity.

original: 咸師事之聽其進止後遇便風同侶皆發。
analyzed: 咸師事之聽其進止後遇便風同侶皆發。
translated: They all served him and listened to his instructions. Later, when the wind was favorable, the companions all set off.
Xian said,
It cannot be moved.
The ship captain stopped.

original: 既而有先發者一時覆敗。
analyzed: 既而有先發者一時覆敗。
translated: Soon after, those who set off first were all overturned and destroyed.

original: 後於闇夜之中忽令眾舶俱發。
analyzed: 後於闇夜之中忽令眾舶俱發。
translated: Later, in the middle of the dark night, he suddenly ordered all the ships to set off together.
No one was willing to follow.

original: 賢自起收纜唯一舶獨發。
analyzed: 賢自起收纜唯一舶獨發。
translated: Xian himself got up and took in the sails, and only one ship set off alone.
Suddenly the pirates arrived.
Those who stayed were all plundered and killed.
Soon after, he arrived at Donglai County in Qingzhou.
He heard that Kumārajīva was in Chang'an.
He immediately went to follow him.
Kumārajīva greatly rejoiced and discussed the Dharma with him.
He inspired the profound and subtle, and there was much to be understood and benefited.
He then said to Kumārajīva,
What you have explained does not surpass people's expectations.
Why have you attained such a lofty reputation?
Kumārajīva said,🔽What I have said is not necessarily good. I just speak according to my understanding. I have not yet attained the wisdom of the sages. How could I dare to be conceited?
It is only because I am old.
Why must I be able to speak beautifully?
Every time Kumārajīva had doubts, he would discuss them with him.
At that time, Yao Xing, the ruler of the Later Qin, focused his efforts on the scriptures and the Dharma.
He provided offerings to over three thousand monks.
They all came and went to the palace, cultivating human relationships.

original: 唯賢守靜不與眾同。🔽後語弟子云。
analyzed: 唯賢守靜不與眾同。 後語弟子云。
translated: Only Sengxian guarded his stillness, not the same as the others.

original: 我昨見本鄉有五舶俱發。
analyzed: 我昨見本鄉有五舶俱發。
translated: Later, he told his disciples, I saw five ships from my hometown setting sail yesterday.
Then the disciples spread the news to outsiders.

original: 關中舊僧咸以為顯異惑眾。
analyzed: 關中舊僧咸以為顯異惑眾。
translated: The old monks in Guanzhong all considered it to be a manifestation of the supernatural to confuse the masses.
Moreover, when Sengxian was in Chang'an, he greatly promoted Chan practice.

original: 四方樂靜者並聞風而至。
analyzed: 四方樂靜者並聞風而至。
translated: All those from the four directions who enjoyed tranquility heard of him and came.
But those who were dyed in learning had shallow and deep levels.
Those who attained the Dharma had strong and weak degrees.
The false and vulgar followers took advantage of this to be deceitful.
One of his disciples, because of a little meditation practice,
claimed to have attained the fruit of an anāgāmin.
Sengxian did not immediately investigate him.
This led to the spread of rumors and he was greatly slandered.
He was about to suffer an unpredictable disaster.
So some of the disciples hid their names and left secretly.
Some jumped over the walls and ran away at night.
In half a day, the crowd dispersed almost completely.
Xian was calm and did not take it to heart at all.

original: 時舊僧僧䂮道恒等謂賢曰。
analyzed: 時舊僧僧䂮道恒等謂賢曰。
translated: At that time, the old monks Seng Rui, Dao Heng, and others said to Xian:
The Buddha did not allow us to speak of the Dharma we have attained.
You previously said that five ships will arrive,
but it is empty and not true.
Moreover, the disciples deceive and confuse each other, creating similarities and differences.
Since you violate the precepts and do not agree with us,
you should leave now and not stay long.
Xian said:
My body is like a floating weed, it is very easy to come and go.

original: 但恨懷抱未申以為慨然耳。
analyzed: 但恨懷抱未申以為慨然耳。
translated: I just regret that my thoughts have not been expressed, and this makes me sigh.

original: 於是與弟子慧觀等四十餘人俱發。
analyzed: 於是與弟子慧觀等四十餘人俱發。
translated: Then he left with more than forty disciples, including Hui Guan.
His spirit and demeanor were relaxed, and he had no different expression.
Those who recognized the truth all sighed with pity.
Several thousand people, both monastics and laypeople, saw him off.

original: 姚興聞去悵恨乃謂道恒曰。
analyzed: 姚興聞去悵恨乃謂道恒曰。
translated: Yao Xing heard of his departure and was disappointed. He said to Dao Heng:
The śramaṇa Buddhajīva came to travel along the Way.
He wanted to proclaim the bequeathed teachings.
He had not yet spoken,
which was deeply regrettable.

original: 豈可以一言之咎令萬夫無導。
analyzed: 豈可以一言之咎令萬夫無導。
translated: How could he allow the fault of one word to make the guidance of ten thousand people disappear?
Therefore, he ordered to have him pursued.
Jīva said to the messenger,
I truly know the gracious decree, but I have not yet received the order.
Then, he led his companions to travel south in the night.

original: 廬岳沙門惠遠素欽風德。
analyzed: 廬岳沙門惠遠素欽風德。
translated: The śramaṇa Huiyuan of Mount Lu had long admired his style and virtue.

original: 乃遣使入關致書祈請後至廬岳忻然如舊。🔽遠以賢之。
analyzed: 乃遣使入關致書祈請後至廬岳忻然如舊。 遠以賢之。
translated: He sent a messenger to enter the pass to write a letter requesting him. Later, when he arrived at Mount Lu, he was delighted as if it were old times.
Huiyuan considered Jīva's banishment to be due to his disciples.

original: 若懸記五舶止說在同意。
analyzed: 若懸記五舶止說在同意。
translated: If the prophecy of five ships only speaks of agreement,
it is also not a violation of the precepts.

original: 乃遣弟子曇邕致書姚主及關中眾僧解其擯事。
analyzed: 乃遣弟子曇邕致書姚主及關中眾僧解其擯事。
translated: He then sent his disciple Tan Yong to write a letter to the ruler Yao and the monks of Guanzhong to resolve the matter of Jīva's banishment.
Huiyuan then requested him to translate various sūtras on meditation and numerology.
Jīva's intention was to travel and transform, not to dwell seeking comfort.
He stayed at the mountain for a year.
He then went west to Jiangling.
When the foreign ship captain met him, he inquired about him.

original: 果是天竺五舶先所見者也。
analyzed: 果是天竺五舶先所見者也。
translated: Sure enough, he was the one seen by the five ships from India earlier.
The people of the prefecture vied to come and pay respects to him.
Whatever offerings were made to him, he did not accept any of them.
He held his alms bowl and went on alms round, not discriminating between the noble and the humble.

original: 時陳郡袁豹為宋武帝太尉長史。
analyzed: 時陳郡袁豹為宋武帝太尉長史。
translated: At that time, Yuan Bao of Chen Jun was the Adjutant of the General of the Right of Emperor Wu of the Song Dynasty.
Emperor Wu of the Song went south to attack Liu Dun.
Bao followed the government office to Jiangling.

original: 賢將弟子慧觀詣豹乞食。
analyzed: 賢將弟子慧觀詣豹乞食。
translated: Xian's disciple Hui Guan went to Bao to beg for food.
Bao, who did not believe in Buddhism, treated him with great contempt.
Before he was full, he said goodbye and left.
Bao said,
It seems you're not full yet. Stay a little longer.
Xian said,
The donor's mind of giving is limited.
Therefore, what is now offered is already exhausted.
Bao then called the attendants to add more rice.
The rice was indeed all gone.
Bao was greatly ashamed.
He then asked Hui Guan,
What kind of person is this śramaṇa?
Guan said,
His virtue and wisdom are lofty and profound, not something ordinary people can fathom.
Bao deeply admired him and reported it to the Minister of Education.
The Minister of Education invited him to meet him.
He greatly revered him and provided him with all the necessary supplies.
Soon after, the Minister of Education returned to the capital.
He invited him to return with him.
He stayed at Daochang Temple.
Xian's deportment and conduct were generally different from the Chinese customs.
But his aspirations and literary style were pure, far-reaching, and had a profound meaning.

original: 楊都法師僧弼與名德沙門寶林書曰。
analyzed: 楊都法師僧弼與名德沙門寶林書曰。
translated: Yangdu Dharma Master Sengbi wrote a letter to the renowned monk Baolin, saying:
Dharma Master Toutian has a very great mind.

original: 便是天竺王何風流人也。
analyzed: 便是天竺王何風流人也。
translated: He is indeed a person of the king's style in India.
His reputation was like this.
Previously, the monk Zhi Faling

original: 於于闐國得華嚴梵本三萬六千偈。
analyzed: 於于闐國得華嚴梵本三萬六千偈。
translated: obtained the Sanskrit version of the Flower Ornament Sutra, consisting of 36,000 verses, in the country of Khotan.
It had not yet been translated.
In the 14th year of Yixi,
Meng Yi, the Governor of Wu Commandery,

original: 右衛將軍褚叔度。🔽即請賢為譯匠。
analyzed: 右衛將軍褚叔度。 即請賢為譯匠。
translated: and Chu Shude, the General of the Right Guard,🔽invited Xian to be the translator.
He then held the Sanskrit text in his hand.

original: 共沙門法業慧嚴慧義等百有餘人。
analyzed: 共沙門法業慧嚴慧義等百有餘人。
translated: Together with more than a hundred people including the śramaṇas Fayuan, Huiyan, Huiyi, and Huiyi,
he translated and edited the sūtra at Daochang Temple.

original: 文旨會通華戎妙得經體。
analyzed: 文旨會通華戎妙得經體。
translated: The text and meaning were harmonized with Chinese and foreign languages, and the essence of the sūtra was wonderfully captured.

original: 故道場寺猶有華嚴堂焉。
analyzed: 故道場寺猶有華嚴堂焉。
translated: Therefore, Daochang Temple still has the Flower Ornament Hall.

original: 又沙門法顯於天竺所得僧祇梵本復請賢譯。
analyzed: 又沙門法顯於天竺所得僧祇梵本復請賢譯。
translated: Moreover, the śramaṇa Faxian obtained the Sanskrit text of the Mahāsāṃghika Vinaya from India and again requested that An Shigao translate it.

original: 賢從安帝隆安二年戊戌。
analyzed: 賢從安帝隆安二年戊戌。
translated: An Shigao, from the second year of Emperor An's Long'an period (戊戌),
to the second year of the Song Dynasty's Yongchu period (辛酉),
in Yangdu and Mount Lu,

original: 譯華嚴等經總一十三部。
analyzed: 譯華嚴等經總一十三部。
translated: translated a total of thirteen sūtras including the Flower Ornament Sūtra.
He thoroughly understood the profound meaning and captured the essence of the text.
An Shigao entered nirvana in the sixth year of the Song Dynasty's Yuanjia period.

original: 春秋七十有一矣又僧祐長房二錄復云賢出新微密持經即出生無量門持經是不合雙載對彼支謙先譯故加新字又有菩薩十住及本業經此之二經並是華嚴別品覺賢既譯大部不合別出此經其本業一經周入藏錄有未見其本且復存之十住一經刪之不立也。
analyzed: 春秋七十有一矣又僧祐長房二錄復云賢出新微密持經即出生無量門持經是不合雙載對彼支謙先譯故加新字又有菩薩十住及本業經此之二經並是華嚴別品覺賢既譯大部不合別出此經其本業一經周入藏錄有未見其本且復存之十住一經刪之不立也。

These should not be listed together, as they were translated by Zhi Qian earlier, so the word new was added. There are also the Sutra on the Ten Stages of the Bodhisattva and the Sutra on the Fundamental Activities. These two sutras are both separate chapters from the Flower Ornament Sutra. Since Jue Xian has already translated the complete text, it is inappropriate to separately publish this sutra. As for the Sutra on the Fundamental Activities, it is included in the Zhou Dynasty's Catalog of Scriptures but its text has not yet been seen, so it is still preserved. The Sutra on the Ten Stages has been deleted and is not included.

original: 雜問律事二卷初出見長房錄右一部二卷本闕。
analyzed: 雜問律事二卷初出見長房錄右一部二卷本闕。

Shaman Tanmo.
Jin translates as Dharma.
Skilled in the study of the Vinaya.

original: 以安帝隆安四年庚子三月二日。
analyzed: 以安帝隆安四年庚子三月二日。
translated: On the second day of the third month in the Gengzi year of the Long'an era of Emperor An,

analyzed: 於楊都尚書令王法度精舍。
translated: at the Jing she monastery of Wang Fadu, the Prefect of the Imperial Secretariat, in Yangdu.

original: 沙門釋僧遵等二十餘德。
analyzed: 沙門釋僧遵等二十餘德。
translated: More than twenty virtuous ones, including the Shamen Shi Seng Zun,

original: 請譯雜問律事序具卷首。
analyzed: 請譯雜問律事序具卷首。
translated: requested to translate the preface to Miscellaneous Questions on Vinaya Matters, which is fully contained in the first fascicle.
Clearly distinguishing the mutual interactions between the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

original: 分齊差殊甚要須善防護。
analyzed: 分齊差殊甚要須善防護。
translated: The distinctions in their respective boundaries are very important and must be well guarded.

original: 十誦律毘尼序三卷亦云十誦律序今合入十誦末後三卷是房云毘尼誦注云是十誦後善誦非也其善誦有四卷是十誦中第十誦也見二秦錄雜問律事二卷眾律要用第二出見二秦錄右二部五卷前毘尼序三卷見在後雜問事二卷本闕。

The śramaṇa Vimalākṣa.
Jin means pure eyes. He was from Kāśmīra.
He was calm and determined.

original: 幼出家履道苦節成務為人眼青。
analyzed: 幼出家履道苦節成務為人眼青。
translated: He left home at a young age to practice the Way. He made austerity his task. He had blue eyes.
At that time, he was also called the Vinaya Master with Blue Eyes.
He first spread the Vinaya Piṭaka in Kucha.
Students from all directions competed to study under him.
Kumārajīva was also among them at that time.
and when Kucha was invaded,
he then fled to Wucheng.

original: 頃之聞什在長安大弘經藏。
analyzed: 頃之聞什在長安大弘經藏。
translated: Soon he heard that Kumarajiva was in Chang'an greatly promoting the canon.

original: 叉欲使毘尼勝品復洽東國。
analyzed: 叉欲使毘尼勝品復洽東國。
translated: He wished to make the superior Vinaya teachings flourish again in the Eastern Land.

original: 於是杖錫流沙冒險東入。
analyzed: 於是杖錫流沙冒險東入。
translated: Thus he crossed the desert and risked his life to enter the East.

original: 以姚秦弘始八年達自關中。
analyzed: 以姚秦弘始八年達自關中。
translated: In the eighth year of Hongshi of the Yao Qin dynasty, he arrived in Guanzhong.
Kumarajiva treated him with the respect of a teacher.
Dharmayaśas was also delighted to meet him from afar.
When Kumarajiva passed away,
Dharmayaśas, in the Yixi years of Emperor An of the Jin dynasty,
then traveled to the left of the pass.
He stayed at Shijian Temple in Shouchun.
The Vinaya disciples gathered like clouds and greatly expounded the Vinaya.

original: 羅什所譯十誦五十八卷。
analyzed: 羅什所譯十誦五十八卷。
translated: The ten recitations translated by Kumarajiva in fifty-eight scrolls.
The last recitation is called the method of receiving the precepts.
And the matters of cultivating good dharmas.
Following its essential meaning, it is called the Good Recitation.
Dharmayaśas later changed the Good Recitation to the Vinaya Recitation.
Thus the two names remain.

original: 復出三卷律序置之於後。
analyzed: 復出三卷律序置之於後。
translated: He also produced a three-scroll preface to the Vinaya and placed it at the end.

original: 總成六十一卷高僧傳及長房錄乃云開前五十八卷為六十一卷者小非詳審也其毘尼序三卷或有近代經本編在第九誦後第十誦前卷當第五十五六七者非也今檢古十誦本乃在第十誦後卷當第五十九至六十一今者依古本為正。

original: 頃之南適江陵於辛寺夏坐。
analyzed: 頃之南適江陵於辛寺夏坐。
translated: After that, he went south to Jiangling and stayed at Xin Temple during the summer retreat.
He lectured on the Ten Recitations Sutra.
Since he could speak Chinese well, he was able to communicate.
The wonderful basis of non-action was greatly proclaimed.

original: 當時析文求理者其聚如林。
analyzed: 當時析文求理者其聚如林。
translated: At that time, those who analyzed the text and sought the principle gathered like a forest.
Those who understood the precepts and prohibitions were also numerous.
The Vinaya canon was greatly promoted.
This was the power of Cixi.
Later, he published two fascicles of miscellaneous questions on the Vinaya.

original: 道場慧觀筆受高僧傳云道場慧觀深括宗旨記其所制內禁輕重撰為二卷送還京師僧尼披尋競相傳寫時闇者諺曰卑羅鄙語慧觀才錄都人繕寫紙貴如玉今謂雜問律事乃是道場慧觀於教有疑隨事諮問卑摩為決聞便錄之撰成二卷流行於世即非別有梵本卑摩譯之其曇摩出者亦即此是錄家誤載也。

He was fond of virtue and enjoyed seclusion, abandoning the hustle and bustle of worldly affairs.
In the winter of that year, he returned to Shijian in Shouchun.
He passed away in the temple.

original: 大般泥洹經六卷經記云方等大般泥洹經或十卷

analyzed: 十二卷見在後二部一十四卷闕本。
translated: Chang Fang's catalog Miscellaneous Abhidharma Heart, 13 fascicles, second edition, the same text as that translated by Sanghadeva of the Fu Qin, etc., seen in Seng You's catalog, Fang says it was translated by Xuan and Jue Xian together Buddha's Travels in India, 1 fascicle, seen in Seng You's catalog, the above seven works, twenty-six fascicles, the first five works, twelve fascicles, are extant, the last two works, fourteen fascicles, are lost.
Śramaṇa Shi Faxian.
Originally surnamed Gong.
A person from Wuyang, Pingyang.
Faxian had three older brothers.
They died one after another in their youth.
His father was afraid.
When Faxian was a few years old, he was released to become a monk.
After living there for several years, he became seriously ill and was about to die.
He was then sent back to the temple, and after a few days he recovered.
He refused to return again.
His mother wanted to see him but could not.

original: 為立小屋於門外以擬去來。
analyzed: 為立小屋於門外以擬去來。
translated: A small house was built for him outside the gate, to accommodate his comings and goings.
At the age of ten, he experienced the grief of losing his father.
His uncle, because his mother was widowed and had no one to rely on,
forced him to return to lay life.
Xian said:
I did not leave home because I had a father.

original: 正欲遠塵離俗故入道耳。
analyzed: 正欲遠塵離俗故入道耳。
translated: I just wanted to distance myself from dust and worldly affairs, so I entered the path.
His uncle approved his words and stopped.
Soon after, his mother passed away. His nature was beyond ordinary people.
After the funeral was over, he immediately returned to the temple.

original: 嘗與同學數十人於田中刈稻。
analyzed: 嘗與同學數十人於田中刈稻。
translated: Once, with several dozen classmates, he was reaping rice in a field.
At that time, there were starving bandits who wanted to steal their grain.
All the novice monks fled.
Only Xian stayed and said to the bandits:
If you need grain, take as much as you want.

original: 但君等昔不布施故此生飢貧。
analyzed: 但君等昔不布施故此生飢貧。
translated: But you did not practice charity in your past lives, so you are born hungry and poor now.

analyzed: 今復奪人。 恐來世彌甚。
translated: Now you are stealing from others again.🔽I fear it will be even worse in your next life.

original: 貧道預為君憂故相語耳。
analyzed: 貧道預為君憂故相語耳。
translated: I am worried for you in advance, so I am telling you.
After saying this, he returned.
The bandits abandoned the grain and left.
The many monks, numbering in the hundreds, all marveled at him.

original: 及受大戒志行明潔儀軌整肅。
analyzed: 及受大戒志行明潔儀軌整肅。
translated: After receiving full ordination, his conduct was clear and pure, and his deportment was solemn.

original: 常慨經律舛闕誓志尋求。
analyzed: 常慨經律舛闕誓志尋求。
translated: He always lamented the discrepancies in the scriptures and precepts, and vowed to seek them out.
In the third year of Long'an of Emperor An,

original: 與同學慧景道整慧應慧嵬等發自長安。
analyzed: 與同學慧景道整慧應慧嵬等發自長安。
translated: together with his classmates Huijing, Daozheng, Huìyìng, Huìwěi, and others, they set out from Chang'an.
They crossed the Western Desert.
Above there were no flying birds, below no running beasts.
Looking around, it was vast and boundless, with no way of knowing where they were going.
They could only look at the sun to determine east and west.
They used human bones to mark the way.
There were often hot winds and evil spirits.
If they encountered them, they would surely die.
Xian entrusted his fate to them and went straight through the dangers.
After a while, they reached the Pamir Mountains.
The mountains have snow all year round.
There are evil dragons that spit out poisonous winds and rain sand and gravel.
The mountain road is difficult and dangerous, standing thousands of feet high.
In the past, someone carved a stone path.
Beside it, a ladder path was set up.
In total, there were more than seven hundred ladders to cross.

original: 又躡懸絙過河數十餘處。
analyzed: 又躡懸絙過河數十餘處。
translated: They also stepped on hanging ropes to cross rivers, more than ten places in total.

original: 皆漢時張騫甘父所不至也。
analyzed: 皆漢時張騫甘父所不至也。
translated: These were places that Zhang Qian and Gan Fu of the Han Dynasty did not reach.

original: 次度小雪山遇寒風暴起。
analyzed: 次度小雪山遇寒風暴起。
translated: Next, they crossed the Little Snow Mountains and encountered a violent cold wind.
Huijing shivered and was unable to move forward.
Yu Xian said:
I am going to die.
You should leave now and not die together with me.
After saying this, he died.
Xian touched him and wept, saying:
The original plan has not been accomplished. What can be done about fate?
He then mustered his strength and traveled alone, passing through mountains and dangers.
He passed through more than thirty countries in total.
He reached North India and then went to the Central Kingdom.
More than thirty li away from Rājagṛha,
he stayed in a temple at dusk.
The next morning, Xian wanted to go to Gṛdhrakūṭa Mountain.
The monks in the temple remonstrated, saying:
The road is very difficult and dangerous, and there are many black lions.
They have often eaten people. How can you get there?
Xian said:
I have traveled many thousands of miles and vowed to reach Vulture Peak.

original: 身命不期出息非保豈可使積年之誠既至而廢耶。
analyzed: 身命不期出息非保豈可使積年之誠既至而廢耶。
translated: I do not expect to keep my life or breath. How can I let my sincerity accumulated over many years be wasted just because I have arrived here?
Although there are dangers, I am not afraid.
The crowd could not stop him.
So they sent two monks to accompany him.
When Xuan arrived at the mountain, it was already dusk.
He then wanted to stay overnight.
The two monks were frightened and left, returning.

original: 顯獨留山中燒香禮拜翹感舊跡如覩聖儀。
analyzed: 顯獨留山中燒香禮拜翹感舊跡如覩聖儀。
translated: Xuan stayed alone in the mountain, burning incense, paying homage, and feeling deeply moved, as if he were seeing the holy image.

original: 至夜有三黑師子來蹲顯前。
analyzed: 至夜有三黑師子來蹲顯前。
translated: At night, there were three black lions that came and squatted in front of Xuan.
Licking their lips and wagging their tails.
Xuan recited the sutra without stopping, single-mindedly thinking of the Buddha.

original: 師子乃低頭下尾伏顯足前。🔽顯以手摩之呪曰。
analyzed: 師子乃低頭下尾伏顯足前。 顯以手摩之呪曰。
translated: The lions then lowered their heads, lowered their tails, and knelt at Xuan's feet.
Xuan stroked them with his hand and said, If you want to harm me, wait until I finish reciting.
If you see me testing, then you can leave.
The lions stayed for a long time before leaving.
The next morning, he returned along the road, which was deep and secluded.
The bushes were overgrown, and birds and beasts roamed freely.
There was only one path that could be used.
Before reaching a mile, he suddenly encountered an old man.
He was about ninety years old, with a simple appearance and attire.
But his spirit and energy were outstanding.
Although Xuan felt that his bearing was lofty,
But did not realize that he was a divine person.

original: 須臾進前逢一年少道人。
analyzed: 須臾進前逢一年少道人。
translated: After a while, he went further and met a young monk.
Xian asked:
Who was that elder just now?
The answer was:
He is the disciple of Tuṣita, Mahākāśyapa.
Xian then sighed with regret for a long time.
Having arrived in front of the mountain,
there was a large rock blocking the entrance to the cave.
Therefore, he was unable to enter.

original: 顯乃流涕致敬而去今謂顯所陟者是雞足山大迦葉波入寂之所非佛舊居處鷲峯山也又至迦施國。
analyzed: 顯乃流涕致敬而去今謂顯所陟者是雞足山大迦葉波入寂之所非佛舊居處鷲峯山也又至迦施國。
translated: Xian then wept and paid respects before leaving. Now, what Xian ascended was Mount Jiashu, where Mahākāśyapa entered quiescence, not the old residence of the Buddha, Vulture Peak Mountain. He also arrived in the country of Kāśi.
Inside the temple, there was a white-eared dragon.

original: 每與眾僧約令國內豐熟。
analyzed: 每與眾僧約令國內豐熟。
translated: Every year, it made an agreement with the monks to ensure abundant harvests in the country.
Everyone had faith and followed it.

original: 沙門為起龍舍并設福食。
analyzed: 沙門為起龍舍并設福食。
translated: The monks built a dragon house for it and set up blessed food.
Every year, at the end of the summer retreat,
the dragon would always transform into a small snake.
Both of its ears were white.
Everyone recognized it as the dragon.
They placed it in a copper bowl filled with yogurt.
From the senior monks to the junior monks, they practiced it.
It was like paying respects.
After going around, it transformed and left.
It appeared once a year.
Xian also personally saw this dragon.
Later, he returned to Central India.

original: 於摩竭提巴連弗邑阿育王塔南天王寺。
analyzed: 於摩竭提巴連弗邑阿育王塔南天王寺。
translated: At the Deva Temple south of the Aśoka Stūpa in Pāṭaliputra, Magadha,
he obtained the Mahāsāṃghika-vinaya.
He also obtained the Sāṃmitīya-vinaya-piṭaka,
the Abhidharma-hṛdaya-sūtra,

original: 方等泥洹等經此方等泥洹即六卷大般泥洹經之梵本也准經後記名為方等大般泥洹經非謂三卷方等泥洹也。
analyzed: 方等泥洹等經此方等泥洹即六卷大般泥洹經之梵本也准經後記名為方等大般泥洹經非謂三卷方等泥洹也。
translated: and the Vaipulya Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra (this Vaipulya Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra is the Sanskrit version of the six-fascicle Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra. According to the postscript of the sūtra, it is called the Vaipulya Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra, not the three-fascicle Vaipulya Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra).
Xian stayed there for three years,
studying Sanskrit and writing himself.
He then entrusted the scriptures and images to merchants,
and they arrived in Siṃhala.
More than ten of Xian's companions either stayed or died.
Looking at his own shadow, he was the only one left, always feeling sad.
Suddenly, in front of the jade statue, he saw merchants.
He offered a white round fan from Jin land as an offering.
He suddenly felt sad and tears flowed down.
After two years, he got it back.
The Mahīśāsaka Vinaya, the long and miscellaneous Āgamas,
and the original miscellaneous scriptures,
which were not in the Han land.
In the country of Siṃhala, there was a Buddha tooth.
Every year in the third month, the king of that country,
ten days in advance, would adorn a white elephant.
He would send a highly regarded wise minister with eloquence,
who would put on the king's clothes, go on the elephant, beat the drum,
and proclaim in a loud voice:
The Tathāgata was in the world for forty-five years.
He taught the Dharma and liberated countless millions of people.
When the karmic conditions of sentient beings were exhausted, he entered parinirvāṇa.

original: 自爾已來一千四百九十七載。
analyzed: 自爾已來一千四百九十七載。
translated: Since then, it has been 1,497 years.
The world is long in darkness and sentient beings are pitiable.

original: 却後十日佛齒當出無畏精舍。
analyzed: 却後十日佛齒當出無畏精舍。
translated: In ten days, the Buddha's tooth will emerge from the Fearless Monastery.
You may prepare incense and flowers and come to make offerings.
At that time, it was the first year of the Yixi era in the Jin dynasty.

original: 計從義熙元年太歲乙巳。🔽至今開元十八年歲次庚午。
analyzed: 計從義熙元年太歲乙巳。 至今開元十八年歲次庚午。
translated: Counting from the first year of Yixi, the year of the earth-tiger,🔽to the present 18th year of Kaiyuan, the year of the earth-horse,

original: 便成一千八百二十二載矣。
analyzed: 便成一千八百二十二載矣。
translated: it has been 1,822 years.
Then, he boarded a large merchant ship and
returned east along the sea.
There were about 200 people on the ship.
They encountered a great storm and the ship was damaged and water entered.

original: 眾人惶怖即取雜物棄之。
analyzed: 眾人惶怖即取雜物棄之。
translated: The people were frightened and threw various things overboard.
Xian was afraid that the merchants would discard his scriptures and images.
He single-mindedly contemplated Avalokiteśvara
and took refuge in the monks of China.
The ship rode the wind and arrived without damage.

original: 行九十日達耶婆提國停五月。
analyzed: 行九十日達耶婆提國停五月。
translated: After 90 days, they reached the country of Yavati and stayed for five months.
They then followed other merchants east to Guangzhou.
After raising the sails for more than a month,
a sudden great wind struck and the entire ship shook with fear.
The people discussed together, saying:
It is because we are carrying this śramaṇa.
It has caused us to be in such a predicament.

original: 不可以一人故令一眾俱亡。
analyzed: 不可以一人故令一眾俱亡。
translated: We cannot let the entire group perish because of one person.
He wanted to throw them away.

original: 法顯檀越厲聲訶商人曰。
analyzed: 法顯檀越厲聲訶商人曰。
translated: Faxian's patron scolded the merchants, saying:

original: 汝若下此沙門亦應下我。
analyzed: 汝若下此沙門亦應下我。
translated: If you put down this śramaṇa, you should also put me down.
Otherwise, you will be killed.
The emperor of China respects the Buddha and venerates the monks.
When I return there, I will report to the king and he will surely punish you.

original: 商人相視失色僶俛而止。
analyzed: 商人相視失色僶俛而止。
translated: The merchants looked at each other, their faces drained of color, and they reluctantly stopped.
When the water ran out and the provisions were exhausted,
they could only follow the current with the wind.

original: 忽至岸見藜藋菜依然知是漢地。
analyzed: 忽至岸見藜藋菜依然知是漢地。
translated: Suddenly, they reached the shore and saw quinoa plants. They knew it was Chinese territory,
but they had not yet determined which region it was.
They took a small boat and entered the inlet to search for a village.
They encountered two hunters.
Xian asked, What place is this?
The hunters said:

original: 是青州長廣郡牢山南岸。
analyzed: 是青州長廣郡牢山南岸。
translated: This is the southern shore of Mount Lao in Changguang Prefecture, Qingzhou.
The hunters returned and reported to the prefect Li Yi.
Li Yi had always respected and believed in Buddhism.
Suddenly, he heard that a śramaṇa had come from afar.
He personally went out to greet and serve him.
Xian brought the scriptures and images back with him.
After a while, he wanted to return south.
At that time, the prefect invited him to stay for the winter.
Xian said,
I have thrown myself into a land where I will not return.
My intention is to spread the teachings.
I cannot stay long without achieving my goal.
He then went south to Jiankang.

original: 於道場寺。🔽就外國禪師佛陀跋陀羅。
analyzed: 於道場寺。 就外國禪師佛陀跋陀羅。
translated: At Daochang Temple,
he translated the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra and other six texts with the foreign meditation master Buddhabhadra.
He compiled the Record of Travels to India in one fascicle.
After Xian translated the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra,
he spread the teachings and made everyone see and hear it.
There was a family whose name was lost,
living near Zhuque Gate in Yangdu.
They had always upheld the correct teachings.
They copied a copy themselves and recited and made offerings to it.
There was no separate sutra repository.
It was stored in the same room as miscellaneous books.
Later, a wind and fire suddenly arose and spread to their house.
All their belongings were burned to ashes.
Only the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra remained intact.
The charred embers did not touch it and the color of the scrolls was no different.
Yangdu spread the word and all praised it as a divine marvel.
Later, he arrived in Jingzhou and passed away at Xin Temple.
He was 86 years old.
The assembly all mourned and cherished him.

analyzed: 菩薩十住經一卷是華嚴十住品異譯見長房錄寶
